name: Somalia
currentCrisisSummary:
Somalia endures converging **structural crises**: protracted civil war stemming from **state collapse** induced by **Cold War** legacies and **neoliberal policies**; an entrenched al-Shabaab insurgency born from failed '**War on Terror**' interventions; and **climate catastrophe** devastating livelihoods.

These dynamicsâ€”amplified by **geopolitical competition**, **external military interference**, and **predatory extraction** (illegal fishing, resource claims)â€”produce chronic suffering. Millions are displaced, services disintegrated, and mass hunger recurs.

Aid efforts are hindered by insecurity. Preventing cycles of famine requires Somali-led political solutions, civilian protection, and large-scale **climate adaptation support** alongside **reparations for ecological damage**.

colonialRoot.legacy:
The crisis is rooted in the **colonial partitioning** during the **Scramble for Africa**. Britain, Italy (and France) divided a cohesive people with **artificial borders**, disrupting traditional systems.

The rushed post-colonial merger left unresolved tensions, fragility compounded by **Cold War geopolitics** and frequent **external interventions**.

historicalContext.title: Neoliberalism and State Collapse
historicalContext.description: The 1991 **state collapse** was preceded by economic crisis and **neoliberal intervention**. In the 1980s, the indebted Barre regime accepted **IMF-led Structural Adjustment Programmes (SAPs)**. These enforced **deregulation**, destroying farmers' livelihoods. Mandated **austerity** **hollowed out the state's** capacity, accelerating social breakdown.

historicalContext.title: The Fragmented State
historicalContext.description: **State collapse** unfolded in a **Cold War** context (Barre backed by USSR then US). Post-collapse saw repeated **external interventions** often prioritising military objectives over Somali-led settlement.

historicalContext.title: The War on Terror and the Rise of Al-Shabaab
historicalContext.description: The post-9/11 '**Global War on Terror**' framework drove conflict. The 2006 **US-backed Ethiopian invasion** ousted the Islamic Courts Union (ICU), shattered stability, and catalysed al-Shabaab's rise (**blowback**). Decades of **drone strikes**, **special forces operations**, and **proxy interventions** entrenched violence, undermining reconciliation.

historicalContext.title: Climate Change and Economic Exploitation
historicalContext.description: Somalia is on the frontline of **climate change**: droughts/floods destroy livelihoods. **State collapse** enabled illicit activity: **illegal fishing** by foreign fleets and **toxic-waste dumping** eroded coastal livelihoods. New resource competition risks conflict. These drivers create **ecological and economic injustice**: the Global North's emissions and commercial practices impose heavy costs.

historicalContext.title: International Law And Accountability
historicalContext.description: **International responsibility** is contested. Abuses by state/non-state actors, violations in counter-insurgency, and **exploitation by transnational actors** are documented. **Accountability** is uneven; strengthening documentation and Somali-centred **transitional justice** is key.

humanitarianImpact.title: Casualties
humanitarianImpact.description: Hundreds of thousands killed by direct conflict and recurring **famines** (e.g., ~258k excess deaths in 2011) driven by war, **state collapse**, and **climate shocks**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Affected Population
humanitarianImpact.description: Roughly 7 million require aid due to devastation from war, **climate catastrophe**, and **economic predation**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Food Insecurity
humanitarianImpact.description: About 4.4 million face acute hunger from **conflict**, **climate change**, and **economic collapse**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Displacement
humanitarianImpact.description: About 3.5 million internally displaced by **conflict** and **extreme weather events** linked to **global warming**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Refugees
humanitarianImpact.description: Approx. 714,000 refugees driven abroad by chronic violence and lack of basic means.

humanitarianImpact.title: Healthcare Collapse
humanitarianImpact.description: Health system decimated by decades of conflict and **state failure**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Lack of Water Access
humanitarianImpact.description: Over half lack safe water due to **infrastructure destruction** and state incapacity from **collapse** and **austerity**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Education Denied
humanitarianImpact.description: Est. 3 million children denied education by **conflict destroying schools** and displacing families.

timeline.event: **Colonial Partition**: The British, Italian, and French empires carve up Somali-inhabited lands during the Scramble for Africa, creating artificial borders and political fragmentation.
**Independence & Unification**: Former British and Italian territories unite to form the Somali Republic, inheriting complex clan, regional and governance challenges.
**Siad Barre's Coup**: General Siad Barre seizes power, later aligning with the USSR; subsequent policies centralise power and sow grievances.
**Ogaden War**: Somalia's intervention in Ethiopia ends in military defeat and shifts Cold War alignments, accelerating militarisation.

**Structural Adjustment**: The indebted Barre regime accepts IMF-led austerity programmes. The deregulation of agriculture destroys rural livelihoods and deepens the economic crisis that precedes state collapse.
**State Collapse**: Barre's overthrow precipitates state collapse, civil war and the fragmentation of authority that creates long-term displacement and insecurity.

**International Intervention**: A US-led, UN-mandated humanitarian intervention ('Operation Restore Hope') withdraws after the 1993 Battle of Mogadishu; international engagement shifts repeatedly between humanitarian and military imperatives.

**US-Backed Invasion & Rise of Al-Shabaab**: A US-backed Ethiopian invasion ousts the Islamic Courts Union government in Mogadishu. The intervention shatters a period of relative stability and directly leads to the rise of al-Shabaab, the ICU's more radical youth wing.
**Famine & Drought**: A catastrophic famine and severe food insecurity event causes very high mortality and displacement, with later studies estimating around 258,000 excess deaths during 2010-2012.
**Climate Extremes & Renewed Crisis**: Repeated failed rainy seasons, severe drought followed by floods, and funding shortfalls drive renewed waves of displacement and acute food and nutrition needs.

donate.description: A Somali-led humanitarian and development organisation delivering cash, water and sanitation support and locally led resilience programmes.
Delivers emergency food and nutrition support across Somalia and to internally displaced and food-insecure populations.

advocacy: Push for increased, flexible climate finance and humanitarian funding that is channelled directly to Somali-led organisations and community networks.
Demand accountability for illegal fishing and toxic-waste dumping, and support coastal communities' rights to their marine resources.
Advocate for a shift from predominately militarised counter-terror strategies to Somali-led political processes, inclusive governance and investment in resilient livelihoods.
Support expanded humanitarian access, protection for civilians and strengthened monitoring of rights abuses by all armed actors.

reading.title: *Making Sense of Somali History: Volume 1*
reading.description: Abdurahman Abdullahi (Baadiyow) offers a scholarly account of Somali history across pre-colonial, colonial and post-colonial periods from a Somali perspective.

reading.title: *Dirty Wars: The World Is a Battlefield*
reading.description: Jeremy Scahill's critical investigation into the US 'War on Terror', detailing its disastrous interventions and consequences in Somalia.

reading.title: *The Fate of Africa: A History of Fifty Years of Independence*
reading.description: Martin Meredith provides essential context on post-colonial state failure across Africa, including the dynamics leading to Somalia's collapse.
